text: a little more than a year ago people
like me were writing stories like this
one about Rush Limbaugh at the time he
was facing the most serious advertiser
rebellion in his long broadcasting
history you may remember he called a
dork town law student a prostitute and
other offensive words as a reaction to
her advocacy for the Obama
administration's contraception policy
dozens of advertisers said they pulled
their ads from the rush limbaugh show
which is syndicated across the country
by clear channel some time has passed
and most people have forgotten about
that ad boycott but Lou Dickey hasn't
Dickey is the CEO of cumulus one of the
biggest competitors to Clear Channel
these two companies are like frenemies
they compete in local markets across the
country but they also depend on each
other sometimes for programming in every
three months or so ludek he comes out on
his earning call and says that he's
still feeling the effects of that
advertiser boycott as recently as March
he said quote there has been some
residual hangover on the talk side in
terms of advertisers sitting out in
other words he says advertisers are not
willing to put their ads back on shows
like the rush limbaugh show then on
sunday there was this headline in the
New York Daily News rush limbaugh says
don't blame me for W ABC's declining ad
sales Limbaugh is now according to this
report and others threatening to take
his top rated show off of cumulus
stations take it away from them and
maybe put it on Clear Channel's owned
stations he's only under contract for
about six more months and such a change
could be an earthquake in the radio
world some of this just feels like
posturing and here's why cumulus is next
earnings call is Tuesday and at that
time Lou Dickey will again probably
comment on how the ad boycott has
affected cumulus revenue but we'll find
out at the end of the year if this is
just posturing because that contract is
coming due and Lou Dickey and others
accumulates have said in the past they
have doubts about the longevity of right
wing talk radio's popularity perhaps
they're about to test that theory out
there there used to be a day where there
was no Fox News there was no
conservative talk radio nothing
